20110112230758.000|20110112230801.000|TR0|This is not a night for politics.
20110112230801.000|20110112230803.000|TR0|
20110112230803.000|20110112230806.000|TR0|DAVID FRUM, PRESIDENTIAL SPEECHWRITER:  
20110112230806.000|20110112230808.000|TR0|People want to know that life has meaning. 
20110112230808.000|20110112230810.000|TR0| These kinds of disasters that just strike 
20110112230810.000|20110112230813.000|TR0|out of nowhere and seemingly for no reason 
20110112230813.000|20110112230815.000|TR0|or for crazy reasons and touch people so 
20110112230815.000|20110112230818.000|TR0|devastatingly that the way we reaffirm 
20110112230818.000|20110112230820.000|TR0|meaning is to show, first, an identity 
20110112230820.000|20110112230823.000|TR0|with the people we've lost who they have 
20110112230823.000|20110112230825.000|TR0|not lost their individuality even in death.
20110112230825.000|20110112230827.000|TR0|

20110112230830.000|20110112230832.000|TR0|congregation of so many people in one 
20110112230832.000|20110112230835.000|TR0|space to hear the president means that the 
20110112230835.000|20110112230837.000|TR0|whole community is affirming that we are 
20110112230837.000|20110112230840.000|TR0|together, we are committing ourselves to 
20110112230840.000|20110112230842.000|TR0|care for the bereaved, and we are not 
20110112230842.000|20110112230844.000|TR0|going to allow memory to be lost.
20110112230844.000|20110112230847.000|TR0|
20110112230847.000|20110112230849.000|TR0|BLITZER:  Every president has a different 
20110112230849.000|20110112230852.000|TR0|style at preparing speeches, especially 
20110112230852.000|20110112230854.000|TR0|important speeches like this.  President 
20110112230854.000|20110112230857.000|TR0|Clinton had a style.  President Bush had a 
20110112230857.000|20110112230859.000|TR0|different style.  We know President Obama 
20110112230859.000|20110112230901.000|TR0|has a different style.  But how in general 
20110112230901.000|20110112230904.000|TR0|does a White House speechwriter, Jonathan, 
20110112230904.000|20110112230906.000|TR0|work with the president and making sure 
20110112230906.000|20110112230909.000|TR0|that the president utters the right words.
20110112230909.000|20110112230911.000|TR0|
20110112230911.000|20110112230914.000|TR0|PRINCE:  Well, so, I'll give you, you 
20110112230914.000|20110112230916.000|TR0|know, the example of the Oklahoma City 
20110112230916.000|20110112230918.000|TR0|memorial speech.  And what we did in that 
20110112230918.000|20110112230921.000|TR0|situation was we reached out to some of 
20110112230921.000|20110112230923.000|TR0|the president's friends and advisers, to 
20110112230923.000|20110112230926.000|TR0|some religious and spiritual leaders on 
20110112230926.000|20110112230928.000|TR0|the country, got some thoughts, took them 
20110112230928.000|20110112230931.000|TR0|in, then, a couple of us worked together 
20110112230931.000|20110112230933.000|TR0|to put a draft in the president's hands 
20110112230933.000|20110112230936.000|TR0|with enough time for him to then really 
20110112230936.000|20110112230938.000|TR0|work out on himself and internalize it and 
20110112230938.000|20110112230940.000|TR0|change it and improve it.
20110112230940.000|20110112230943.000|TR0|
20110112230943.000|20110112230945.000|TR0|And then, it would come back to us, and 
20110112230945.000|20110112230948.000|TR0|there'd be a little bit of an iterative 
20110112230948.000|20110112230950.000|TR0|process, but, you know, typically what you 
20110112230950.000|20110112230953.000|TR0|do is you do some reach out, get some 
20110112230953.000|20110112230955.000|TR0|opinions, kind of coalesce these opinions, 
20110112230955.000|20110112230957.000|TR0|and then bring it together.  You know, 
20110112230957.000|20110112231000.000|TR0|obviously, everyone brings their own kind 
20110112231000.000|20110112231002.000|TR0|of perception and backgrounds to the 
20110112231002.000|20110112231005.000|TR0|table, and you work with the president to 
20110112231005.000|20110112231007.000|TR0|make sure that he's comfortable at the end 
20110112231007.000|20110112231010.000|TR0|of the day.
20110112231010.000|20110112231012.000|TR0|
20110112231012.000|20110112231014.000|TR0|I'll give you one great example of the 
20110112231014.000|20110112231017.000|TR0|speech in which the President Clinton made 
20110112231017.000|20110112231019.000|TR0|a huge edit.  We've put a line in there 
20110112231019.000|20110112231022.000|TR0|that said, "The God of comfort is also the 
20110112231022.000|20110112231024.000|TR0|God of righteousness."  And President 
20110112231024.000|20110112231027.000|TR0|Clinton changed it to say, "Teach your 
20110112231027.000|20110112231029.000|TR0|children that the God of comfort is also 
20110112231029.000|20110112231031.000|TR0|the God of righteousness."  Just vastly 
20110112231031.000|20110112231034.000|TR0|improving the line and making more his.

20110112231039.000|20110112231041.000|TR0|President Bush after 9/11, David.  Share a

20110112231046.000|20110112231048.000|TR0|FRUM:  Well, I would argue a little bit 
20110112231048.000|20110112231051.000|TR0|against interest here as a writer and to 
20110112231051.000|20110112231053.000|TR0|say that what the president does 
20110112231053.000|20110112231056.000|TR0|nonverbally is as important as what he 
20110112231056.000|20110112231058.000|TR0|says.  And when I think back on President 
20110112231058.000|20110112231101.000|TR0|Bush on that extended period of morning 
20110112231101.000|20110112231103.000|TR0|after 9/11, the image that is sharpest in 
20110112231103.000|20110112231105.000|TR0|my mind is a service he participated in 
20110112231105.000|20110112231108.000|TR0|for victims of the Pentagon bombings, 
20110112231108.000|20110112231110.000|TR0|specifically, where what you saw was he 
20110112231110.000|20110112231113.000|TR0|had completely absorbed the grief and pain 
20110112231113.000|20110112231115.000|TR0|of these people, and he was so sad.  It 
20110112231115.000|20110112231118.000|TR0|was real to him.
20110112231118.000|20110112231120.000|TR0|
20110112231120.000|20110112231123.000|TR0|It was not just words.  It was not 
20110112231123.000|20110112231125.000|TR0|something to read.  The president here, he 
20110112231125.000|20110112231127.000|TR0|is the head of the nation.  He's no longer 
20110112231127.000|20110112231130.000|TR0|the head of the government, no longer the

20110112233613.000|20110112233616.000|TR0|reaction when you hear Dr. Rhee say that?
20110112233616.000|20110112233618.000|TR0|
20110112233618.000|20110112233620.000|TR0|DR. SANJAY GUPTA, CNN CORRESPONDENT:  
20110112233620.000|20110112233623.000|TR0|Well, you know, this idea of spontaneous 
20110112233623.000|20110112233625.000|TR0|movement is certainly something that you 
20110112233625.000|20110112233628.000|TR0|look for. When you start to decrease the 
20110112233628.000|20110112233630.000|TR0|sedation in someone, obviously, they're 
20110112233630.000|20110112233633.000|TR0|going to be more wakeful.  And the 
20110112233633.000|20110112233635.000|TR0|question is how are they reacting now that 
20110112233635.000|20110112233637.000|TR0|they're more wakeful and allowed to be in 
20110112233637.000|20110112233640.000|TR0|a more conscious state not under the 
20110112233640.000|20110112233642.000|TR0|influence of these meds?
20110112233642.000|20110112233645.000|TR0|
20110112233645.000|20110112233647.000|TR0|What I heard specifically, Wolf, was not 
20110112233647.000|20110112233650.000|TR0|only was she moving spontaneously, but 
20110112233650.000|20110112233652.000|TR0|also moving purposely, trying to fix the 
20110112233652.000|20110112233654.000|TR0|gown, you know, adjust her gown that she's 
20110112233654.000|20110112233657.000|TR0|wearing, trying to feel the wounds that 
20110112233657.000|20110112233659.000|TR0|she has, as well.  So these are purposeful 
20110112233659.000|20110112233702.000|TR0|movements, as opposed to sometimes people 
20110112233702.000|20110112233704.000|TR0|just have reflective movements, and that's 
20110112233704.000|20110112233707.000|TR0|a very different sort of movement.  So 
20110112233707.000|20110112233709.000|TR0|spontaneous, purposeful movements is 
20110112233709.000|20110112233711.000|TR0|exactly what you want to see when the 
20110112233711.000|20110112233714.000|TR0|sedation gets lifted.
20110112233714.000|20110112233716.000|TR0|

20110112234314.000|20110112234316.000|TR0|police investigators now that the morning 
20110112234316.000|20110112234319.000|TR0|that the shootings occurred, the father, 
20110112234319.000|20110112234321.000|TR0|and our -- the chief investigator had 
20110112234321.000|20110112234324.000|TR0|already told us this -- that the father of 
20110112234324.000|20110112234326.000|TR0|Jared ran into his son that very morning

20110112234331.000|20110112234333.000|TR0|

20110112234336.000|20110112234338.000|TR0|and what are you doing?"  He told police 
20110112234338.000|20110112234341.000|TR0|that his son just mumbled something.  He 
20110112234341.000|20110112234343.000|TR0|couldn't understand what he was saying, 
20110112234343.000|20110112234345.000|TR0|and then he took off.
20110112234345.000|20110112234348.000|TR0|

20110112234350.000|20110112234353.000|TR0|after his son to try to figure out what 
20110112234353.000|20110112234355.000|TR0|was going on, but he couldn't catch up 
20110112234355.000|20110112234358.000|TR0|with him, and figured he just went off to 
20110112234358.000|20110112234400.000|TR0|the desert somewhere.
20110112234400.000|20110112234402.000|TR0|
20110112234402.000|20110112234405.000|TR0|So that important new piece of information 
20110112234405.000|20110112234407.000|TR0|about what happened on the morning of the 
20110112234407.000|20110112234410.000|TR0|shooting.  In addition, police are telling 
20110112234410.000|20110112234412.000|TR0|us this night that they found some

20110112235432.000|20110112235435.000|TR0|(BEGIN VIDEOTAPE)

20110112235437.000|20110112235440.000|TR0|JEANNE MOOS, CNN CORRESPONDENT 
20110112235440.000|20110112235442.000|TR0|(voice-over):  After this report, you may 
20110112235442.000|20110112235444.000|TR0|think ATM stands for automated toilet 
20110112235444.000|20110112235447.000|TR0|machines.  ATMs aren't just flush with 
20110112235447.000|20110112235449.000|TR0|money; they're flush with bacteria.  Take 
20110112235449.000|20110112235452.000|TR0|it from a microbiologist.
20110112235452.000|20110112235454.000|TR0|
20110112235454.000|20110112235457.000|TR0|RICHARD HASTINGS, BIOCOTE MICROBIOLOGIST:  
20110112235457.000|20110112235459.000|TR0|The ATM, the PIN pad were as contaminated 
20110112235459.000|20110112235501.000|TR0|as public toilets.
20110112235501.000|20110112235504.000|TR0|
20110112235504.000|20110112235506.000|TR0|MOOS:  In a British study, ATM keypads and 
20110112235506.000|20110112235509.000|TR0|toilet seats were swabbed.  The amount and 
20110112235509.000|20110112235511.000|TR0|type of bacteria found were comparable.
20110112235511.000|20110112235514.000|TR0|
20110112235514.000|20110112235516.000|TR0|UNIDENTIFIED MALE:  How are people using 
20110112235516.000|20110112235518.000|TR0|these ATMs?  Are they sitting on the
